title: Summoner Wars
subtitle: Conquer the Battlefields of Itharia
description: Summoner Wars is a fast-paced, tactical 2-player game. Players take on the role of Summoners, leading their faction to conquer the war-torn world of Itharia through the power of mysterious Summoning Stones.

factionSelection.title: Choose Your Faction
factionSelection.subtitle: Each summoner commands a unique army and tactics

move: Each unit moves up to 2 spaces
build: Place in back 3 rows or adjacent to your summoner
attack: Ranged: up to 3 spaces in a straight line
draw: No draw if deck is empty

tutorial.title: Summoner Wars Tutorial
tutorial.welcome: Welcome to Summoner Wars! In this game, you will play as a powerful Summoner, commanding your army to conquer the battlefield.

steps.welcome:
Welcome to Summoner Wars!

This is the battlefield ‚Äî an 8√ó6 grid. Your units are at the bottom, your opponent's at the top.

Destroy the enemy Summoner to win!
steps.summonerIntro:
This is your Summoner "Ret-Talus".

He has 12 Life, 2 Strength, and is a ranged attacker (range 3).

He's your most important unit ‚Äî lose him and you lose the game!
steps.enemySummoner:
This is the enemy Summoner.

Destroy them to win the game!
steps.gateIntro:
This is your Gate.

Gates are where you summon new units ‚Äî you can only place units on empty spaces adjacent to your gates.

Protect your gates, and build new portals to expand your summoning range.
steps.handIntro:
This is your hand.

It contains unit cards, structure cards, and event cards that you can play during the appropriate phases.

You draw up to 5 cards at the end of each turn.
steps.cardAnatomy:
Look at this card's attributes:

üíé Cost: Magic required to summon
‚ù§Ô∏è Life: Destroyed when damage equals life
‚öîÔ∏è Strength: Number of dice rolled when attacking

Higher strength means more dice when attacking!
steps.magicIntro:
This is your Magic bar.

Magic is used to summon units and cast cards.

We've set your Magic to 5 for this tutorial.
steps.phaseIntro:
Each turn has 6 phases:

Summon ‚Üí Move ‚Üí Build ‚Üí Attack ‚Üí Magic ‚Üí Draw

You're currently in the Summon phase. Let's begin!
steps.summonExplain:
It's the Summon phase.

Select a unit card from your hand, pay its magic cost, and place it on an empty space adjacent to your gate.
steps.summonAction:
Try summoning a unit!

Click a unit card in your hand to select it, then click a highlighted space next to your gate.
steps.abilityExplain:
Your Summoner has the "Revive Undead" ability:

Deal 2 damage to himself to revive an undead unit from your discard pile to an adjacent space.

There's an Undead Warrior in your discard pile ‚Äî click your Summoner to try it!
steps.abilityAction: Click your Summoner to activate "Revive Undead", then select the Undead Warrior from your discard pile and place it on an adjacent space.
steps.endSummon: Click "End Phase" to enter the Move phase.
steps.moveExplain:
Move phase: Move up to 3 units, each up to 2 spaces.

Only horizontal or vertical ‚Äî no moving through other cards.
steps.moveAction:
Click a unit to select it, then click a highlighted space to move.

Try pushing toward the enemy!
steps.endMove: You can move more units, or click "End Phase".
steps.buildExplain:
The Build phase lets you build gates and cast event cards.

Gates are summoning points ‚Äî more gates means more places to summon units.

Event cards are powerful one-time effects that activate immediately when cast during their designated phase.
steps.eventCardExplain:
You have a "Hellfire Blade" event card in your hand.

Event cards have phase restrictions ‚Äî this one can only be cast during the Build phase.

Once cast, it attaches to a friendly common unit, granting +2 Strength, but the unit takes backlash damage after attacking.
steps.eventCardAction: Click the "Hellfire Blade" event card in your hand, then select a friendly common unit on the board to attach it to.
steps.buildAction: Event card played! Click "End Phase" to enter the Attack phase.
steps.attackExplain:
Attack phase! Attack with up to 3 units.

Strength = number of dice. Only matching attack type faces deal damage.

‚ö†Ô∏è If you don't attack, your Summoner takes 1 penalty damage!
steps.meleeExplain:
‚öîÔ∏è Melee units can only attack adjacent targets (up/down/left/right).

Melee dice face ‚öîÔ∏è = 1 damage.
steps.rangedExplain:
üèπ Your Summoner is a ranged unit.

Ranged units can attack targets up to 3 spaces away in a straight line ‚Äî dealing damage from a safe distance!
steps.attackAction:
Click your unit to select it, then click an enemy target in range to attack!

Try using your Summoner's ranged attack on an enemy unit.
steps.attackResult:
Dice results determine hits. ‚ú¶ Special faces deal no damage by default (unless an ability says otherwise).

When damage equals Life, the unit is destroyed. Destroying an enemy grants 1 Magic!
steps.endAttack: You can attack with more units, or click "End Phase".
steps.magicExplain:
Magic phase: Discard cards to gain magic.

1 discarded card = 1 Magic. Convert unneeded cards into resources!
steps.magicAction: Click cards to select them for discard, or "End Phase" to skip.
steps.drawExplain:
Draw phase: Automatically draw up to 5 cards.

Note: If your deck is empty, you can't draw!
steps.endDraw: Click "End Phase" to end your turn.
steps.inactionPenalty:
The opponent didn't attack any of your units, so their Summoner took 1 penalty damage.

This is the "Inaction Penalty" ‚Äî it encourages aggressive play!
steps.victoryCondition:
Remember: Protect your Summoner while finding ways to destroy theirs!

That's the key to victory.
steps.finish:
Congratulations on completing the tutorial!

You've learned the 6 turn phases, basic summoning/moving/attacking, event card casting, and how to use Summoner abilities.

Now go challenge a real opponent!
